FuncDef:
The qos channel alarm command configures the bandwidth or channel usage threshold for a resource pool.
The undo qos channel alarm command cancels the configuration.
By default, no bandwidth or channel usage thresholds are configured for a resource pool.
CLIs: qos channel alarm { quantity | bandwidth } threshold <value> [ pool-0 | pool-1 ]
undo qos channel alarm { quantity | bandwidth } [ pool-0 | pool-1 ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the bandwidth or channel usage threshold, in percentage.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100.

ExtraInfo: To configure the bandwidth or channel usage threshold for a resource pool, run the qos channel alarm command. After this command is run on a device, the device periodically reads the data at the bottom layer. When the bandwidth or channel usage exceeds or falls below the threshold, a log is generated. If a log indicating that the bandwidth or channel usage exceeds the threshold already exists, no such logs will be generated, even if the bandwidth or channel usage exceeds the threshold again. If a log indicating that the bandwidth or channel usage falls below the threshold already exists, no such logs will be generated, even if the bandwidth or channel usage falls below the threshold again. After the undo qos channel alarm command is run, no logs indicating that the bandwidth or channel usage exceeds or falls below the thresholds are generated.
